## TIL20220405

### dplyr

```{r}
data <- data.frame(
  x1 = 1:6,
  x2 = c(1,2,2,3,1,2),
  x3 = c("F", "B", "C", "E", "A", "D")
); data;
```
```{r}
if(!require(dplyr)) { install.packages("dplyr"); library(dplyr); }
```

```{r}
arrange(data, x3)
```
```{r}
filter(data, x2 == 2)
```

```{r}
mutate(data, x4 = x1 + x2)
```

```{r}
pull(data, x2); class(pull(data, x2))
```

```{r}
rename(data, new_name = x3)
```

```{r}
set.seed(765)
sample_n(data, 3)
```

```{r}
select(data, c(x2, x3))
```
